title.rendered: “Unraveling the IDF’s Precision Strike in Rafah: An In-depth Investigation into a Counter-Terrorism Operation”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

The Chief of Staff’s Investigation Mechanism will investigate the IDF attack last night in Rafah

The Chief Military Advocate, Major General Jaf’at Tomer Yerushalmy, has instructed the Chief of Staff’s Investigation Mechanism to initiate an investigation into the attack in Rafah.

Last night (Sunday) an aircraft attacked significant terror targets in Rafah, including senior members of the Hamas organization’s military wing, who were planning attacks by Hamas operatives in Judea and Samaria and carried out murderous attacks against citizens of the State of Israel. The attack was carried out on the basis of prior intelligence information about the terrorists’ location.

Before the attack, numerous steps were taken to minimize the chance of harming uninvolved individuals, including aerial reconnaissance, the use of precision munitions and additional intelligence information, based on which it was assessed that no harm was expected to uninvolved civilians.

Moreover, the attack was not carried out in the humanitarian zone of al-Mu’awasi, to which the IDF had called for the population to evacuate.

The event is being investigated by the Chief of Staff’s Investigation Mechanism, an independent body responsible for examining extraordinary events in warfare. The mechanism is investigating the circumstances regarding the citizens’ deaths in the area of the attack. The IDF regrets any harm to uninvolved individuals in the framework of combat.

An infographic on the topic is attached: https://IDFANC.activetrail.biz/ANC2705202423687324562
